 Common Sense laws are:
 
 1) Instant background checks with no waiting period.
 2) No central database of gun owners.
 3) No gun buy backs.
 4) No gun confiscations.
 5) No gun ownership for felons.
 6) No gun ownership for the insane.
 7) No gun ownership for family violence offenders.
 8) Increased budget for law enforcement of firearm laws.
 9) No increased budget for law enforcement and gun control on same bill before Congress.

Common Sense laws are:
 
 1) Instant background checks with no waiting period.

 
 Back ground check imply guilt! To exercise a right a person must first proven themselves innocent! The law says innocent until proven guilty not the other way around!

 2) No central database of gun owners..

 
 Since 1968 all guns purchased from a federally licensed firearms dealer are registered! The purchase is recorded in a bound book that the atf may examine any time the atf wants to!
 Upon the business going out of business the book is sent to the atf!
 
 If you are going to use the line you purchased it from a private citizen. Well when the first person purchased the gun from the dealer it was registered!
 
 
 3) No gun buy backs...

 
 At gun buy backs there are no questions asked. So a criminal can dispose of a gun used in a crime and no one will know!
 
 
 
 5) No gun ownership for felons....

 
 Felons are in prison, unless released early on parole! On parole they are still under the corrections department control and are not allowed to own guns! Why is it gun haters always use this lie! Why not just keep the dangerous felons in prison if they are to dangerous to own guns!
 
6) No gun ownership for the insane. ....

As far as El Al, yes, they do make their own policy, however the must still comply with the policy set forth by the countries they fly to.  I have defined it now over and over again. Here is another definition from a libertarian site since you just do not want to get my definitions. This directly addresses your ignorance:
 
 [/b]"Natural rights are the fundamental political concept, and are derived from the proper ethical basis (enlightened self-interest). Since man's prime value is his own life, the prime right is the right of life, and by extension self-ownership. Only by protecting life can a society ensure the free exercise and flourishing of the lives of its own citizens.
 
 All rights are derived from the right of life. With the possession of one's body comes the right of one's actions. One can hardly be said to own his life if he is not free to act as he sees fit. The same thing applies to the result of these actions, which is property. All individual rights can be subsumed to the rights of self-ownership, action and property.
 
 
 Natural rights are natural because they are derived from objective deductions and observations, and therefore give us an optimal pattern of government to follow. In practice, this means that a government's functions should be limited to protecting the natural rights of its citizens, instead of using them for its own benefit. Such a government would be completely libertarian.
 
 An objection to the notion of natural rights is that they are not materially obvious - for example, governments break them regularily. How could they exist ? But rights are not material entities. They are indications of the pattern of laws which is optimal for a human society. The same thing could be said of a standard. Even if some manufacturers don't follow a given standard, this does not make that standard any less desirable"[/b]

Have you ever heard "the kingdom of heaven is within you?" Show me where this comes from.
 
 
 
 Reverend HellH0und
 
 
 "Wherefore my bowels shall 
 sound like an harp" -ISAIAH 16:11
kelvin90701

WHAT?!?!?! Please show me historically how you come to a preposterous conclusion.... In fact the USA was about to kick the soviets a$$es at the end of WWII but (unfortunatly) we showed restraint.
 
 I guess the only help they did give us was being bullet sponges and making the krauts use up all thier ammo..

 
 
 You are seriously delusional if you think the Soviets saved our hinnie in WW2. I do not ever remember the Soviets fighting the Germans on US soil.
 
 The Soviets saved thier own hinnie. They did it with US lend lease and and waves of human bullets sponges.
 
 No country came to help the USA. No country sent 18 years olds to our country to save us.
 
 Everyone who took part hand thier own herioc effort. You are mistaken to think that anyone saved OUR hinnie.
voiceofreason

You know I am an ordained minister. I perform marriages, give sermons, consel people, and do hospice work.

 How do you answer this? When the chief priests came to arrest Jesus, Peter pulled out his sword to defend Jesus. Jesus told him to put his sword away and said that "all who draw the sword will die by the sword." If Jesus was against the use of a weapon to defend himself how can you possibly justify using a weapon to defend yourself?
Rev. HellH0und

How do you answer this? When the chief priests came to arrest Jesus, Peter pulled out his sword to defend Jesus. Jesus told him to put his sword away and said that "all who draw the sword will die by the sword." If Jesus was against the use of a weapon to defend himself how can you possibly justify using a weapon to defend yourself?

 
 Easy:
 
 Luke 22:36: "But now if you have a purse, take it, and also a bag; and if you don't have a sword, sell your cloak and buy one." 
 
 But in my own words. We are all children of G-d. Bhuddist, Muslim, pagan, Christian, etc... This very image of heaven we have in ourselves. The very being of G-d is withing us. Is there anything more precious and more worhty of defense than that? Why do Bhuddist monks train in martial arts. Why is there a martial art called Aikido which teaches a non violent (albiet ineffective in its current form IMHO) solution to aggression. The Jews in Germany tried it non-violence (warsaw ghetto excepted) and all that got them was a free train ride and a gas shower. 
 
 
 I own and shoot guns because of the value I put on life. I am willing to defend through mortal combat, myself, my family, my country, even you if needed and do so with a clear conscious of inner peace knowing that right actions, right thoughts are my guide. Because I am on equal footing in capabilities with those who would cause harm. I can truly fight for the peace and liberty we as the human kind hold so dear.
 
 
 
 
 I leave you with the wise words of the ages:
 
 "A pacifist is not really a pacifist if he is unable to make a choice between violence and non-violence. A true pacifist is able to kill or maim in the blink of an eye, but at the moment of impending destruction of the enemy he chooses non-violence. He chooses peace. He must be able to make a choice. He must have the genuine ability to destroy his enemy and then choose not to." -Takamura
 
 "I believe in the sun even though it is slow in rising. I believe in you without realizing. I believe in rain though there are no clouds in the sky. I believe in truth even though people lie. I believe in peace though sometimes I am violent. I believe in God even though he is silent."
 --Unknown 
 
 "Peace is not the absence of war; it is a virtue; a state of mind; a disposition for benevolence; confidence; and justice." 
 --Spinoza 
 
 "Peace, in the sense of absence of war, is of little value to someone who is dying of hunger or cold. Peace can only last where humans [have justice]." -- The 14th Dalai Lama
 
 
 
 Reverend Hellh0und
voiceofreason

I'm amazed that such a list exists. So much for the end of witch-hunting.

 In this article the author has some interesting comments on the NRA's blacklist. 
 
 "The leaders of the National Rifle Association have put out a 19-page blacklist....But the enemies are my kind of people. The American Medical Association. The National Education Association. The League of Women Voters, for gawdsake. The list of 'anti-gun' religious groups is nothing if not ecumenical, ranging from the U.S. Catholic Conference to the B'nai B'rith to the United Methodist Church. The corporate blacklist, for that matter, includes every one of my food groups, from Stonyfield Yogurt to Sara Lee cheesecake. As for the list of individuals in and out of Hollywood, they picked the president and first lady -- of 'The West Wing' that is. They listed Harvey Weinstein, the old pacifist producer of 'Kill Bill,' Sean Connery, whose 007 career involved more weapons than your average weekend gun show, and Britney Spears, whose looks could kill....Outrage One: The NRA wants to make the gun industry the only one in America that you can't sue for negligence. The families of the sniper victims, for example, couldn't even sue the infamous Bull's Eye Shooter Supply, which 'lost' over 200 weapons, including the Bushmaster used in shooting 16 people....Mike Barnes, the head of the Brady Campaign, says, 'The NRA members are much more sensible than the leaders. The leadership really believes we would be safer if we were all walking around carrying AK-47s. They talk about the slippery slope. If I can't have a grenade launcher today, they'll take away my rifle tomorrow.'...Meanwhile, I'm going to get some blacklisted Ben & Jerry's ice cream, open up my blacklisted Washington Post, log on to my computer and post my name. If my old buddies at the NRA want to keep me off, they're going to have to pry this computer mouse out of my cold, dead hands." 
 http://www.workingforchange.com/article.cfm?ItemID=15894

 Why don't you have the guts or the honesty to make a frank admission that the Soviets, and the Chinese contributed more? I know you don't want to lay your red-neck on the line, but constantly daring me to acknowledge US efforts is an indication that you either don't understand when I reply, or you are in some kind of automatic knee-jerk mode that you can't escape from; giving the same reactions regardless of what I post.
